description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国山东省下辖的地级市，国务院确定的沿海开放城市，位于山东省东部。
description.en: A prefecture-level city in northeastern Shandong province, People's Republic of China. It is a coastal city designated as one of the country's open coastal cities.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，现任中国共产党烟台市委员会书记。
description.en: A political figure in the People's Republic of China, currently serving as the Secretary of the Yantai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China.

nodes.id: 中国共产党烟台市委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党烟台市委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在烟台市的领导机关。
description.en: The leading organ of the Communist Party of China in Yantai City.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，现任烟台市人民代表大会常务委员会主任。
description.en: A political figure in the People's Republic of China, currently serving as the Director of the Standing Committee of the Yantai Municipal People's Congress.

nodes.id: 烟台市人民代表大会常务委员会

zh-cn: 烟台市人民代表大会常务委员会

description.zh-cn: 烟台市的国家权力机关。
description.en: The organ of state power in Yantai City.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，现任烟台市人民政府市长。
description.en: A political figure in the People's Republic of China, currently serving as the Mayor of the Yantai Municipal People's Government.

description.zh-cn: 烟台市的国家行政机关。
description.en: The state administrative organ of Yantai City.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，现任中国人民政治协商会议烟台市委员会主席。
description.en: A political figure in the People's Republic of China, currently serving as the Chairman of the Yantai Municipal Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议烟台市委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议烟台市委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议在烟台市的地方组织。
description.en: The local organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference in Yantai City.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的一个朝代。
description.en: A dynasty in Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 指13至16世纪期间，活跃于朝鲜半岛及中国沿岸的海盗。
description.en: Pirates who raided the coastlines of Korea and China between the 13th and 16th centuries.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲国家。
description.en: A country in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 1860年法国军队占领烟台的军事行动及随后的占领时期。
description.en: The military action and subsequent occupation period when French troops occupied Yantai in 1860.

description.zh-cn: 清朝的中央政府。
description.en: The central government of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲国家。
description.en: A country in Europe.

description.zh-cn: 清朝与多国于1858年（咸丰八年）在天津签订的一系列不平等条约，其中包括开放登州（后改为烟台）为通商口岸。
description.en: A series of unequal treaties signed in Tianjin in 1858 between the Qing dynasty and several foreign powers, which included opening Dengzhou (later changed to Yantai) as a treaty port.

description.zh-cn: 晚清名臣，洋务运动的主要领导人之一。
description.en: A leading statesman of the late Qing dynasty and a major leader of the Self-Strengthening Movement.

description.zh-cn: 英国外交家、汉学家，曾任驻华公使。
description.en: A British diplomat, sinologist, and former minister to China.

description.zh-cn: 英国驻华使馆翻译马嘉理在云南被杀的事件，成为英国进一步侵华的借口。
description.en: The murder of Augustus Margary, a British consular officer, in Yunnan, which became a pretext for further British aggression in China.

description.zh-cn: 清政府与英国在烟台签订的不平等条约，作为马嘉理事件的解决方案。
description.en: An unequal treaty signed between the Qing government and the United Kingdom in Yantai as a resolution to the Margary Affair.

description.zh-cn: 美国长老会传教士，将苹果、洋梨等作物引入烟台。
description.en: An American Presbyterian missionary who introduced crops like apples and pears to Yantai.

description.zh-cn: 推翻清朝、建立中华民国的革命。
description.en: The revolution that overthrew the Qing dynasty and established the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国清末由孙中山等组织的革命团体。
description.en: A revolutionary group organized by Sun Yat-sen and others in the late Qing dynasty of China.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命时期在烟台成立的革命政权。
description.en: A revolutionary government established in Yantai during the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间日本的国号。
description.en: The official name of Japan from 1868 to 1947.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争时期中国共产党领导的主要武装力量之一。
description.en: One of the main armed forces led by the Communist Party of China during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国在训政时期的国家武装力量，由中国国民党创建。
description.en: The national armed forces of the Republic of China during the Tutelage Period, founded by the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的主要武装力量。
description.en: The principal military force of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物，曾任烟台市市长，后官至中央政治局常委、全国政协主席。
description.en: A political figure in the People's Republic of China who served as the Mayor of Yantai and later rose to become a member of the Politburo Standing Committee and Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的著名华侨实业家，张裕酿酒公司的创办人。
description.en: A prominent overseas Chinese industrialist in the late Qing and early Republican periods, and the founder of the Changyu Pioneer Wine Company.

description.zh-cn: 中国第一家工业化生产葡萄酒的公司。
description.en: The first industrialized wine production company in China.

description.zh-cn: 美国出版商，创办了《时代》、《生活》和《财富》等著名杂志。
description.en: An American publisher who founded famous magazines such as Time, Life, and Fortune.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上首位完成华夏大一统的政治人物，也是中国第一个称皇帝的君主。
description.en: The first political figure to unify China and the first monarch to be called emperor in Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 秦始皇统一六国后为宣扬国威、求仙访药而进行的一系列巡游活动。
description.en: A series of tours conducted by Qin Shi Huang after unifying the Six States to display national prestige and seek immortality.

description.zh-cn: 亚太区内各地区之间促进经济成长、合作、贸易、投资的论坛。
description.en: A forum for promoting economic growth, cooperation, trade, and investment among economies in the Asia-Pacific region.

relationships.target: 中国共产党烟台市委员会

description.zh-cn: 江成担任中国共产党烟台市委员会书记。
description.en: Jiang Cheng serves as the Secretary of the Yantai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China.

relationships.target: 烟台市人民代表大会常务委员会

description.zh-cn: 朱秀香担任烟台市人民代表大会常务委员会主任。
description.en: Zhu Xiuxiang serves as the Director of the Standing Committee of the Yantai Municipal People's Congress.

description.zh-cn: 张明康担任烟台市人民政府市长。
description.en: Zhang Mingkang serves as the Mayor of the Yantai Municipal People's Government.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议烟台市委员会

description.zh-cn: 于永信担任中国人民政治协商会议烟台市委员会主席。
description.en: Yu Yongxin serves as the Chairman of the Yantai Municipal Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

description.zh-cn: 明朝洪武三十一年（1398年），为防倭寇袭扰，在奇山北麓建奇山守御千户所城，并在“北山”设烽火台。
description.en: In 1398, during the reign of the Hongwu Emperor of the Ming dynasty, the Qishan Guard was established at the northern foot of Mount Qi, and a beacon tower was set up on the 'North Mountain' to defend against raids by Wokou pirates.

description.zh-cn: 1860年6月8日，法国军队占领烟台山，开始了法占烟台时期。
description.en: On June 8, 1860, French troops occupied Yantai Hill, marking the beginning of the French occupation of Yantai.

description.zh-cn: 《天津条约》将登州（后改为烟台）辟为通商口岸，促进了烟台的对外开放和现代化进程。
description.en: The Treaties of Tianjin opened Dengzhou (later changed to Yantai) as a treaty port, promoting Yantai's opening to the outside world and its modernization process.

description.zh-cn: 1861年5月，清政府批准改定烟台为通商口岸，并于同年8月22日正式对外开办。
description.en: In May 1861, the Qing government approved the designation of Yantai as a treaty port, which was officially opened for foreign trade on August 22 of the same year.

description.zh-cn: 为解决马嘉理事件，中英双方在烟台进行谈判并签订了《烟台条约》。
description.en: To resolve the Margary Affair, China and Britain negotiated and signed the Chefoo Convention in Yantai.

description.zh-cn: 北洋大臣李鸿章与英国公使威妥玛在烟台就马嘉理事件进行谈判。
description.en: Beiyang Minister Li Hongzhang negotiated with British Minister Thomas Wade in Yantai regarding the Margary Affair.

description.zh-cn: 美国传教士约翰·倪维思将苹果、洋梨、葡萄等作物从美国带入烟台，并开始广泛种植，对当地农业产生深远影响。
description.en: American missionary John L. Nevius introduced crops such as apples, pears, and grapes from the United States to Yantai and began their widespread cultivation, profoundly influencing local agriculture.

description.zh-cn: 1911年11月12日，同盟会山东分部在烟台举义后，于13日成立了山东军政府。
description.en: On November 12, 1911, after the Shandong branch of the Tongmenghui launched an uprising in Yantai, the Shandong Military Government was established on the 13th.

description.zh-cn: 在辛亥革命期间，烟台于1911年11月12日宣布独立。
description.en: During the Xinhai Revolution, Yantai declared independence on November 12, 1911.

description.zh-cn: 1938年2月3日，日军占领烟台，直至1945年8月24日八路军解放烟台。
description.en: On February 3, 1938, the Japanese army occupied Yantai until its liberation by the Eighth Route Army on August 24, 1945.

description.zh-cn: 1945年8月24日，八路军占领烟台，结束了日军占领。
description.en: On August 24, 1945, the Eighth Route Army occupied Yantai, ending the Japanese occupation.

description.zh-cn: 在胶东战役中，国民革命军于1947年10月1日占领烟台市，直至1948年10月15日解放军重新占领。
description.en: During the Jiaodong Campaign, the National Revolutionary Army occupied Yantai on October 1, 1947, until it was reoccupied by the PLA on October 15, 1948.

description.zh-cn: 1948年10月15日，中国人民解放军重新占领烟台市。
description.en: On October 15, 1948, the People's Liberation Army reoccupied Yantai.

description.zh-cn: 俞正声曾于1987年3月至1989年5月期间担任烟台市市长。
description.en: Yu Zhengsheng served as the Mayor of Yantai from March 1987 to May 1989.

description.zh-cn: 华侨张弼士于1892年投资创建了中国第一家葡萄酒公司——张裕酿酒公司。
description.en: In 1892, the overseas Chinese Chang Pi-shih invested in and founded China's first wine company, Changyu Pioneer Wine.

description.zh-cn: 《时代》杂志创始人亨利·路思义出生于烟台。
description.en: Henry Luce, founder of Time magazine, was born in Yantai.

description.zh-cn: 秦始皇发起了东巡活动，期间到达了芝罘岛。
description.en: Qin Shi Huang initiated an eastern tour, during which he reached Zhifu Island.

description.zh-cn: 前218年，秦始皇东巡至芝罘岛（位于今烟台市），留下了《芝罘刻石》，并始建东巡宫。
description.en: In 218 BC, Qin Shi Huang's eastern tour reached Zhifu Island (in modern-day Yantai), where he left the 'Zhifu Inscription' and ordered the construction of the Dongxun Palace.

description.zh-cn: 1998年6月9日至15日，第二届APEC国际贸易博览会在烟台市举办。
description.en: From June 9 to 15, 1998, the Second APEC International Trade Fair was held in Yantai.
